children.title: Organization Size Categories (By Employee Strength)
children.content:
Organization Size Categories (By Employee Strength)

Category People Strength Typical Use Case Examples
Very Small 1 – 50 Startups, family businesses
Small 51 – 250 Growing SMEs, small agencies
Medium 251 – 1,000 Regional offices, schools, NGOs
Large 1,001 – 10,000 National enterprises, mid-size firms
Very Large 10,001+ Multinationals, Government, Iarge

children.title: 🧠 Other Key Characteristics to Consider (Beyond Size)
children.content:
🧠 Other Key Characteristics to Consider (Beyond Size)

Characteristic Why It Matters for Architecture
Geographical Spread Need for multilingual support, regional rules, time zone handling
Role Complexity Impacts RBAC design in Azure AD & Power Apps
Process Maturity Determines automation levels & AI involvement
Compliance Needs Affects data storage (SharePoint config), audit trail requirements
Integration Needs Determines API design, use of Power Automate for connectors
Data Volume Impacts storage strategy (SQL, Cosmos DB, SharePoint limits)
Self-Service Depth Drives Power Apps design (Model-driven vs Canvas), chatbot depth
AI Readiness Impacts use of Azure OpenAI, Power Virtual Agents, insights architecture
IT Skill Maturity Influences customization vs low-code balance

children.title: 🏗️ Architecture Decisions (SharePoint + Power Platform + .NET)
children.content:
🏗️ Architecture Decisions (SharePoint + Power Platform + .NET)

Org Type Power Platform Use SharePoint Role .NET Focus
Very Small Canvas Apps, Templates Document storage, basic lists Minimal — focus on Power Automate
Small Canvas + some Model-driven Team site + HR doc mgmt Simple APIs (.NET minimal APIs)
Medium Model-driven, chatbots Department sites, compliance docs API-first design, modular services
Large Full Power Platform suite Hub sites, metadata-rich libraries Microservices, Power Automate + .NET
Very Large Complex app orchestration Enterprise content mgmt, versioning .NET microservices, Azure Functions

children.title: Core HRIS Modules
children.content:
Core HRIS Modules

  • Employee Master Data (profile, documents)
  • Leave & Attendance Management
  • Recruitment & Onboarding
  • Payroll & Compensation
  • Performance Management
  • Training & Development (LMS)
  • Exit & Offboarding
  • Compliance & Audit
  • Org Chart & Directory
  • Self-Service Portals (ESS/MSS)

children.title: Stakeholders
children.content:
Stakeholders

  • HR Managers
  • Employees (ESS)
  • Managers (MSS)
  • IT/Admin
  • Executives (BI Dashboards)
  • External Agencies (via secure APIs)

children.title: Tech Stack
children.content:
Tech Stack

Layer Tools/Tech
Frontend Power Apps, React (custom UX)
Backend .NET Core 8+, C#, Azure Functions, App Services
API Management Azure API Management, Swagger/OpenAPI, GraphQL
Database Azure SQL, Cosmos DB, Azure Blob/SharePoint
Messaging/Eventing Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid
AI/GenAI Azure OpenAI, Semantic Kernel, Power Automate AI
Authentication Azure AD, OAuth2, MSAL
CI/CD GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps Pipelines
Monitoring Azure Monitor, App Insights, Log Analytics
DevOps & Infra ARM/Bicep/Terraform, ACR, Kubernetes (AKS)

children.title: Architectural Principles
children.content:
Architectural Principles

  • Cloud-native: Azure primary cloud provider.
  • Microservices-based: Independent modules.
  • API-first: REST APIs, future GraphQL.
  • Event-driven: Azure Event Grid/Service Bus.
  • Composable architecture: Plug-in modules easily.

children.title: 🔗 Integration Platform
children.content:
🔗 Integration Platform

  • Microsoft Power Platform
  • SharePoint Online
  • Azure API Management
  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD)

children.title: AI Use Cases
children.content:
AI Use Cases

Area AI Use Case
Recruitment Resume parsing, candidate ranking
Chatbots HR self-service bot
Performance Reviews AI-generated summaries
Training Personalized learning paths
Knowledge Base Natural language Q&A
Document Automation AI-assisted onboarding docs
Leave/PTO Assistant Natural language chatbot
Employee Sentiment Analyze surveys for attrition

children.title: Implementation Stages
children.content:
Implementation Stages

Stage Description
HRIS Modules Core modules like employee data, leave
AI in Recruitment Resume Parsing, JD Generation
HR Chatbot Employee FAQs, leave guidance
Performance Reviews AI-Generated Feedback
LMS AI Personalized Learning Paths
Document Automation Offer letters, contracts automation
Sentiment Analytics Feedback and survey analysis
Insights Dashboard Predictive analytics, attrition risk
Improved HR Outcomes Faster hiring, reduced attrition

children.title: 📦 Future Ready Architecture
children.content:
📦 Future Ready Architecture

Composability Intelligent Automations Extensibility Security & Compliance Embedded Analytics
Design services as plug-and-play modules. Integrate low-code AI (Power Automate AI Builder, Azure AI). Third-party tools integration. Role-based access control (RBAC) Power BI dashboards
Standardized APIs for internal/external use. Employee digital assistant. Marketplace-style plugins. Data encryption at rest/transit. Predictive analytics with Azure ML.
Compliance: GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2 readiness.

children.title: Implementation Phases
children.content:
Implementation Phases

Phase Modules AI/Automation Focus
Phase 1 Core HR, Leave, Attendance Employee chatbot, doc upload AI
Phase 2 Recruitment, Onboarding, Payroll Resume AI, onboarding automation
Phase 3 Performance, Training, Exit AI feedback gen, learning assistant
Phase 4 Full analytics, integrations Sentiment, attrition AI, smart search

children.title: 📚 Documentation and Governance
children.content:
📚 Documentation and Governance

  • Use Swagger/OpenAPI for all APIs
  • Maintain API Gateway with tiered access
  • Centralized policy management via Azure
  • DevSecOps practices for testing/releases

children.title: 📊 KPIs to Measure Success
children.content:
📊 KPIs to Measure Success

  • Onboarding Time Reduction
  • HR Ticket/Query Automation %
  • AI Suggestion Accuracy
  • Employee NPS/Sentiment
  • System Uptime & Latency

children.title: 🚀 GenAI & AI-Powered Modules
children.content:
🚀 GenAI & AI-Powered Modules

Area Use Case
Recruitment Resume parsing, JD generation, candidate scoring
Chatbot (HR Assistant) Azure OpenAI + Power Virtual Agents
Performance Reviews Feedback generation, insights
LMS Personalized learning paths
Knowledge Base Q&A assistant using Azure Cognitive Search + OpenAI
Document Automation AI-generated offer letters, onboarding kits
Leave & Attendance AI assistant for leave booking
Analytics Sentiment analysis, attrition prediction

children.title: 📁 HRIS Repo Structure
children.content:
📁 HRIS Repo Structure

/hris-platform/
├── frontend/
│   ├── powerapps/
│   └── react-spa/
├── backend/
│   ├── employee-service/
│   ├── leave-service/
│   ├── payroll-service/
│   └── shared-libs/
├── api/
│   ├── gateway/
│   └── openapi-specs/
├── ai/
│   ├── chatbots/
│   ├── prompts/
│   └── models/
├── infrastructure/
│   ├── bicep/terraform/
│   └── aks-config/
├── workflows/
│   ├── power-automate/

├── docs/

│   └── diagrams/
├── .github/
│   └── workflows/
└── README.md

children.title: Modules in Scope
children.content:
• Employee Master Data
  • Leave & Attendance Management
  • Basic Self-Service Portal (ESS)
  • Core API Gateway
  • SharePoint Integration
  • HR Chatbot (basic FAQ + leave queries)

children.title: Architecture Stack
children.content:
LayerTools/Stack
FrontendPower Apps Canvas + optional React SPA
Backend.NET 8 APIs (microservice-based)
DatabaseAzure SQL + SharePoint Lists/Documents
IntegrationAzure API Management
WorkflowsPower Automate (for leave request flows)
AuthenticationAzure AD + MSAL (RBAC, SSO)
ChatbotPower Virtual Agent + Azure OpenAI

children.title: 🤖 AI/Automation
children.content:
🤖 AI/Automation in Phase 1

AreaDescription
HR ChatbotFAQs, leave policy guidance, leave request initiation
Doc UploaderAI auto-tags documents in SharePoint (optional add-on)
Leave AssistantConversational UI to check leave balance, apply leave

children.title: 📅 Timeline
children.content:
📅 Timeline (Recommended)

WeekActivities
1Requirements gathering, Use case validation
2Data modeling (Employee, Leave), Azure infra setup
3Build core microservices (Employee, Leave), SharePoint structure setup
4Frontend (Power Apps), Leave workflow (Power Automate), Auth integration
5HR Chatbot integration
6Testing (unit + UAT), Documentation, Go-live

children.title: 📁 Repo Structure
children.content:
📁 Repo Structure (Phase 1)

/phase1/├── frontend/│   └── powerapps/├── backend/│   ├── employee-service/│   └── leave-service/├── api/│   └── gateway/├── workflows/│   └── leave-request/├── ai/│   └── hr-chatbot/├── infrastructure/│   └── azure-setup/

children.title: 📅 Week 1 Goals
children.content:
📅 Week 1 — Requirements Gathering & Use Case Validation

🎯 Goals:
  • Understand core HR processes (employee onboarding, leave, attendance)
  • Validate user needs (HR, employees, managers)
  • Finalize the MVP scope for Phase 1
  • Identify AI/automation fitment (chatbot, workflows)

children.title: 🧩 Activities Breakdown
children.content:
🧩 Activities Breakdown:
TaskDescription
Stakeholder InterviewsMeet with HR, IT, and selected employees to capture expectations
Current Process MappingDocument existing leave, attendance, and employee master data workflows
Pain Point IdentificationList bottlenecks in the current system (manual entries, delayed approvals)
Define User Roles & PermissionsHR Admin, Employee (ESS), Manager (MSS), System Admin
Use Case Workshop (MVP Scope)Prioritize features: Employee profile CRUD, Leave apply/approve/view
AI Fitment ReviewValidate chatbot FAQ needs, document AI use cases for leave assistant
System Requirements ChecklistDecide core tech (Azure AD, SharePoint Online, Power Apps, SQL, etc.)
Documentation PrepCreate BRD (Business Requirements Doc), Use Case Diagrams, Flowcharts

children.title: 📄 Week 1 Deliverables
children.content:
📄 Key Deliverables by End of Week 1:
  • ✅ Business Requirements Document (BRD)
  • ✅ User Journey Map / Personas
  • ✅ Use Case Catalog (Employee Mgmt, Leave Flow)
  • ✅ Stakeholder Matrix
  • ✅ AI Use Case Feasibility Notes
  • ✅ Tooling/Infra Checklist (Azure resources, licenses, connectors)

children.title: Geographical Spread
children.content:
Geo Spread

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Time Zone DifferencesLeave workflows break without proper time trackingIncorrect timestamps impact SLAsUse UTC in .NET, convertTimeZone() in Power AutomateDuring workflow design.NET, Power Automate, SQL
Holiday ScheduleRegional public holidays varyInvalid leave validationUse region-based holiday tablesLeave request logicSharePoint, SQL, Power Automate

children.title: Role Complexity
children.content:
Role Complexity

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Org HierarchyToo many roles/departmentsAffects access and approvalsUse metadata in Azure AD and Power AppsRBAC definition phaseAzure AD, Power Apps
DelegationManagers go on leaveWorkflow may haltAdd delegation rules to workflow logicWorkflow configurationPower Automate, SQL

children.title: Process Maturity
children.content:
Process Maturity

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Undefined HR FlowsInconsistent approvalsLeads to errors and inefficienciesDocument and standardize via SOPsInitial discovery phasePower Automate, Power Apps
No audit logsCannot track changesNon-compliance riskEnable audit in SharePoint/.NETDesign phaseSharePoint, Azure Monitor

children.title: Compliance Needs
children.content:
Compliance Needs

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Data Location LawsCannot store PII globallyLegal violationUse region-specific Azure data centersData model planningAzure, SharePoint
Retention PoliciesSensitive data not deletedAudit riskEnable SharePoint retention labelsData lifecycle designSharePoint, Compliance Center

children.title: Integration Needs
children.content:
Integration Needs

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Payroll/ERP SyncManual data duplicationData inconsistencyUse Power Automate connectorsPost-MVP planningPower Automate, API Mgmt
No API StandardsIncompatible systemsHard to scaleEnforce Swagger/OpenAPIDuring API dev.NET, API Management

children.title: Data Volume
children.content:
Data Volume

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Large listsPerformance issuesSluggish Power AppsPaginate & filter dataUI DesignPower Apps, SQL
Upload overloadFiles exceed limitsStorage errorsUse SharePoint + Azure Blob for offloadingInfra planningSharePoint, Azure Storage

children.title: Self-Service Depth
children.content:
Self Service Depth

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
Low ESS adoptionHR burdened with manual tasksScalability issueEmpower users via Power AppsUX DesignPower Apps, Power Virtual Agents
Unclear statusesUsers raise repeated queriesFrustrationAdd real-time status trackingFeature designPower Apps, .NET

children.title: AI Readiness
children.content:
Ai Readiness

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
No data for trainingAI models underperformPoor recommendationsStructure historical dataBefore AI buildAzure SQL, Power BI
Trust issuesUsers fear AI biasResistance to adoptionExplainability + guardrailsAI pilot phaseAzure OpenAI, Policy Design

children.title: IT Skill Maturity
children.content:
It Skill Maturity

AspectWhat (Problem)Why (Importance)How (Solution)When (Trigger Point)Where (Tech Involvement)
No in-house devsCan't maintain custom codeSystem rot riskUse low-code Power PlatformEarly architecturePower Apps, Power Automate
OvercustomizationHard to manage upgradesTechnical debtKeep core in Power Platform, APIs in .NETScaling stagePower Platform, .NET
